1) {1,2} is open since it is an element of the topology T: {1,2} ∈ T.

2) {1,3} is not open since it is not an element of the topology T. To confirm this, note that there is no combination of elements in T that can be united to form {1,3}.

3) {1} is not open since it is not an element of the topology T. To confirm this, note that there is no combination of elements in T that can be united to form {1}.

4) {4} is not open since 4 is not an element of X. By definition, a subset of X can only be open if it is an element of the topology T, and since 4 is not in X, {4} cannot be an element of T.
